required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pelvic Floor Muscle Contraction Among Physiotherapy Students Before and After "Women Health" Course
clinical_study.official_title: Pelvic Floor Muscle Contraction Among Physiotherapy Students Before and After "Women Health" Course

brief_summary.textblock: The study aim is to evaluate the ability to correctly contract pelvic floor muscle among physiotherapy students before and after "women health" course. Pelvic floor muscle contraction will be evaluated via transabdominal ultrasound.

detailed_description.textblock:
Physiotherapy students during their studying in the physiotherapy Bachelor degree program will be examined. Students will be divided into 2 groups according to their year of studying (if they already studied "women health course or not implying 4th year students compared with 1-3 year level students). Each participant will be asked to contract the pelvic floor muscles.
The assessment of pelvic floor contraction will be measured by measuring bladder displacement via abdominal ultrasound. A curved linear array transducer will be placed in the transverse plane immediately suprapubically over the lower abdomen angled at 15-30 degrees from the vertical. Upward movement of the bladder during contraction will be marked as correct contraction. An on screen caliper and measurement tool will be used to measure bladder amount of bladder displacement.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 2 groups according to the year of physiotherapy school.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will not know the aim of study

primary_outcome.measure: direction of urinary bladder displacement during contraction
primary_outcome.description: upward or downward displacement of urinary bladder will be measured via diagnostic ultrasound
bladder displacement will be measured via diagnostic ultrasound using the on screen caliper tool

secondary_outcome.measure: pelvic floor muscles endurance of contraction in seconds
secondary_outcome.description: time of muscle contraction will be measured during the last contraction

arm_group.description: The participants will be instructed to contract the pelvic floor muscle
The participants will be instructed to contract the pelvic floor muscle

intervention.description: Ultrasound examination will be performed to asses urinary bladder displacement being a marker for pelvic floor muscle function

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy students
- willing to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- has been treated before for pelvic floor rehabilitation
- active urinary tract infection
- pregnancy
- previous abdominal surgeries

facility.name: Haifa University, Department of PHysical Therapy

results_reference.citation: Ben Ami N, Dar G. What is the most effective verbal instruction for correctly contracting the pelvic floor muscles? Neurourol Urodyn. 2018 Nov;37(8):2904-2910. doi: 10.1002/nau.23810. Epub 2018 Aug 28.

patient_data.ipd_description: the result of the study will be analysed. a paper will be submitted to international journal with study description including methods, examination protocol results
